content.description: start with your right on a nice incut crimp (about a full pad) and a butter undercling with ur left and a small left toe out to the right, reach left up to a nice incut crimp ('bout half a pad) adjust your feet and lunge up to a nice small edge that is slightly slopey, lock that off and lunge to a nasty gastone, get your left foot up and keep your core tite, lock the gastone off with your right and cross left into a killer crimp, lock off the killer crimp, walk your feet over and reach way up to a miserably small incut crimp, position your feet and go to buldgy sidepull, work your self up to a buttery gastone sidepull and throw for the jug at the top. super long route and totally a classic
content.location: Directly above the stupid problem Blinded by the light on the hillside

content.description: Buttery creamy crimps that you can really get your meathooks on lock off. it felt anywhere from v4-v5.

left hand gaston on a miserable incut, right hand on a miserable side pull...go right up to the sloper and top out on the sketchy slab. is on the wall facing davy jones' locker on the left side. this climb is on the sarcophagus boulder.
content.location: on the sarcophagus boulder above davy jones' locker

content.description: start on an incut on the arete with a slopey crimp under the roof. with a high left foot, reach left up to a crimpy undercling. bump right hand to the next crimp, get a right heel and fall right hand into the other side of the undercling match...go right up to the fatty from there and then left up to the razor jug and then top out. the grade felt anywhere from v7 to v9
content.location: azagthoth's lair is on the back side of the sarcophagus boulder facing southwest. it is a small roof like feature and this climb starts on the right side of this feature

content.description: start matched in the dihedral...go left up to neutral slopey edge, match and then heel trickery to crimp with left hand and go right to jug and top out.
content.location: it's near the maze but still in the desert. if you walk to the sport climbing in the wash east of the rail boulder and the parking, the boulder should be up the hill and south. it is hard to find, but if you think you have found it, it is next to an extremely hard project. these are the only two problems on this face/boulder and the project to the left of the arcade is miserable slopers reminiscent of the island in fontainbleau

content.description: Brutal bouldering in a large desert area above Superior, AZ. Many trees and boulders give it decent shade but you can still get murdered in the sun. Not very crowded and we should keep it this way. The rock is volcanic with crimps, pockets, slopers, jugs, you name it.
